title: El surfista y la scooter en Bali
titleTranslation: The surfer and the scooter in Bali

thumbnail.generation_prompt: A surfer with a board walking on a tropical beach at sunset, Bali style, warm colors, peaceful mood.

tags.name: Grammar
tags.description: Past tense (pretérito indefinido and imperfecto), expressing surprise and discovery

tags.name: Themes
tags.description: Travel mishaps, cultural differences, driving rules

content.text: Hace un año fui a Bali para surfear.
content.translation: A year ago I went to Bali to surf.

content.text: Necesitaba un medio de transporte para moverme por la isla.
content.translation: I needed a means of transport to get around the island.

content.generation_prompt: Small rental shop in Bali with scooters parked in front, tropical plants, sign in Spanish and English, sunny day.

content.text: Alquilé una scooter cerca de la playa.
content.translation: I rented a scooter near the beach.

content.text: El dueño me dio las llaves y un casco, pero no me explicó nada sobre el tráfico.
content.translation: The owner gave me the keys and a helmet, but he didn't explain anything about the traffic.

content.text: Salí a la carretera y empecé a conducir por la derecha, como en mi país.
content.translation: I went out onto the road and started driving on the right, like in my country.

content.text: Nadie me dijo que en Indonesia se conduce por la izquierda.
content.translation: Nobody told me that in Indonesia you drive on the left.

content.text: Los primeros días todo parecía normal.
content.translation: The first few days everything seemed normal.

content.generation_prompt: Busy street in Bali with scooters and cars, tropical setting, local drivers, slight chaos but colorful and lively.

content.text: Iba al surf por la mañana y volvía por la tarde.
content.translation: I used to go surfing in the morning and come back in the afternoon.

content.text: A veces me sentía un poco raro cuando los coches me adelantaban.
content.translation: Sometimes I felt a bit strange when cars overtook me.

content.text: Pensaba que los conductores en Bali eran muy atrevidos.
content.translation: I thought the drivers in Bali were very bold.

content.text: Un día un turista me gritó desde su coche: "¡Estás en el lado equivocado!"
content.translation: One day a tourist shouted at me from his car: "You're on the wrong side!"

content.text: No entendí bien y seguí mi camino.
content.translation: I didn't understand well and continued on my way.

content.text: Al tercer día, otra persona me hizo señas para que me cambiara de carril.
content.translation: On the third day, another person waved at me to change lanes.

content.text: Entonces lo busqué en internet y descubrí la verdad.
content.translation: Then I looked it up on the internet and discovered the truth.

content.generation_prompt: Surfer sitting on a scooter at the side of a road, looking at phone with surprised expression, palm trees, Bali, comic relief mood.

content.text: En Indonesia se conduce por la izquierda, igual que en Reino Unido o Japón.
content.translation: In Indonesia you drive on the left, just like in the UK or Japan.

content.text: Yo había estado conduciendo por el lado equivocado durante tres días.
content.translation: I had been driving on the wrong side for three days.

content.text: Menos mal que no pasó nada grave.
Desde entonces siempre pregunto por las normas de circulación cuando viajo.
content.translation: Since then I always ask about the traffic rules when I travel.

medio de transporte.explanation: Phrase: 'medio' is masculine; use 'un' (a) or 'el' (the). Plural: medios de transporte.

alquilar.explanation: Regular -ar verb. Past: alquilé (I rented). Same as 'rentar' in some regions.

derecha.explanation: Noun (la derecha). 'Por la derecha' = on the right. Opposite: la izquierda (left).

izquierda.explanation: Noun (la izquierda). 'Por la izquierda' = on the left. In Indonesia they drive on the left.

adelantar.explanation: Regular -ar verb. 'Me adelantaban' = they were overtaking me (imperfect, repeated action).

señas.explanation: Plural of 'seña'. 'Hacer señas' = to wave or gesture (at someone).

descubrir.explanation: Regular -ir verb. Past: descubrí. Similar to 'enterarse' (to find out).
